pullRequest.title: DB-10006 Reduce memory footprint of CSV reader

commit.message: DB-9912 reduce memory copies in csv reader.
DB-9912 fix bug in refactoring readColumns.

DB-9912 Improve memory footprint of QuoteTrackingTokenizer.

- if the maximum size of some columns exceeds a specific threshold,
  a perliminary scan of the CSV row is done to calculate actual size
  needed for each column.
- the size is used to initialize the StringBuilder used to store the
  data of the column which should give a more predictable performance.
DB-9912 refactor, add tests, fix spotbugs issues.
DB-9912 fix bug in handling unmatched quotes.
DB-9912 fix minor bug in test.

DB-9912 read types from VTI operation only.

- refactoring.
- adapt handling extra columns in CSV columns to current
  expected behavior
DB-10006 set StringBuilder size for first column.

DB-10006 avoid holding reference to row buffer unnecessarily.

- this prevents GC from recycling this row which could be an issue
  if the row is too large as in CLOB case.

nodes.bodyText: I think this call is not needed, we already allocated a StringBuilder big enough for the largest column, the only thing we need is to "clear" the StringBuilder (.setLength(0)) right?

Could we add another check here? If we are parsing with oneLineRecords we could check the length of the current line, if it's less than the scanThreshold we avoid the dryRun too



I think at this point of execution we don't know the actual size of the current CSV line, or maybe I missed some info in your comment?

We can get the size of the current line with getCurrentLine().length() don't we?
What we don't know is whether we are parsing in oneLineRecords mode, we'd need to pass down that flag into the QuoteTrackingTokenizer, or have a helper method in MutableCSVTokenizer (that one only gets used in oneLineRecords mode)

If you want to add a configuration option:

You'd get the config option with SIDriver.driver().getConfiguration().getCsvScanThreshold() (or whatever name you come up with)
You need to add that method to the interface, implementation and ConfigurationBuilder
Add the configuration to a *Configuration class (possibly SQLConfiguration, that's where importMaxQuotedColumnLines is defined)

commit.message:
DB-10006 further optimizations.

- when reading one-line record CSV we skip the dry-run scan and
  instead, immediately assign the column StringBuilder to the size
  of the row itself.
- add row scan size threshold to configurations.
- throw exception if one-line record CSV is read and we encounter
  a multi-line column inside quotes.
- add test and address SpotBugs issues.
